ARTICLE II. - RETIREMENT SYSTEMS  
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 
 
Secs. 82-26—82-35. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 2. - TEXAS MUNICIPAL RETIREMENT SYSTEM[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
State Law reference— Texas municipal retirement system, V.T.C.A., Government Code § 851.001 et seq. 
 
Sec. 82-36. - Election to participate. 
(a)  The board of commissioners hereby exercises its option and elects that the city and all of the employees of all the departments of the city, except members of the fire department eligible for membership in the city firemen's relief and retirement fund, participate in the Texas Municipal Retirement System, and orders that the city retirement system be merged into the Texas Municipal Retirement System pursuant to the "Merger Agreement" hereinafter. 
(b)  Notwithstanding the exception of the fire department from the provisions of subsection (a) of this section, the board of commissioners may, by ordinance, when it deems it in the best interest of the city, include any personnel of the fire department under the Texas Municipal Retirement System when such personnel do not otherwise qualify for the firefighters' relief and retirement fund. The ordinance providing for the addition of any members of the fire department to the Texas Municipal Retirement System shall be filed in the individual's personnel jacket, and the city manager is hereby directed and authorized to give notice of such inclusion to the board of trustees of the Texas Municipal Retirement System. Such ordinance shall not be amendatory of the Code of Ordinances, but shall be otherwise in full force and effect. 
(Code 1966, § 23-11; Ord. No. 1994-91, § I, 12-19-94; Ord. No. 1998-39, § I, 3-26-98)  
Sec. 82-37. - Notice to board of trustees. 
The city manager is hereby directed to notify the board of trustees of the Texas Municipal Retirement System that the city has elected to participate and have the employees of the city departments described in this division participate in such system. 
(Code 1966, § 23-12)  
Sec. 82-38. - Employees included. 
(a)  Each person who is a member of the Texas Municipal Retirement System by reason of his/her employment by the city prior to January 1, 1995, shall continue as a member of the Texas Municipal Retirement System as a condition of his/her continued employment by a participating department. 
(b)  Persons who are participating members of the city retirement system (hereinafter sometimes called "local plan") at the time the local plan is merged into the Texas Municipal Retirement System shall become members of the Texas Municipal Retirement System at that date, and shall continue participating in the Texas Municipal Retirement System in accordance with the terms of the merger agreement. 
(c)  Any person who became an employee of the city on or after January 1, 1995 and prior to the 1st day of May, 1998, but who was not eligible for membership in the city retirement system or in the city firemen's relief and retirement fund, shall become a member of Texas Municipal Retirement System on the latter date, and shall be allowed "prior service credit" as defined in V.T.C.A., § 853.101, Government Code, that is 100 percent of the "base credit" of such member as defined in V.T.C.A., Government Code § 853.105. 
(d)  Each person who becomes an employee of any participating department on or after the 1st day of May, 1998 shall become a member of the Texas Municipal Retirement System as a condition of employment. 
(Code 1966, § 23-13; Ord. No. 1994-91, § II, 12-19-94; Ord. No. 1997-28, § I, 4-15-97; Ord. No. 1998-39, § II, 3-26-98)  
Sec. 82-39. - Addition or discontinuance of departments or employees. 
The city may in the future refuse to add new departments or new employees to the Texas Municipal Retirement System, but shall never discontinue as to any participants. 
(Code 1966, § 23-14)  
Sec. 82-40. - Rate of deposit; maximum earnings subject to contribution. 
(a)  That all employees of the City of McAllen, who are members of the Texas Municipal Retirement system shall make deposits to the system at the rate of seven percent of their individual earnings. 
(b)  Effective date. Subject to approval by the board of trustees of the system, this contribution rate shall be and become effective on the 1st day of October, 2009. 
(Code 1966, § 23-15; Ord. No. 2004-95, § 1, 12-13-04; Ord. No. 2009-38, § I, 7-27-09)  
Sec. 82-41. - Remittance to board of trustees; certification of prior service, etc. 
The director of finance is hereby directed to remit to the board of trustees of the Texas Municipal Retirement System, at its office in Austin, Texas, the city's contributions to the system and the amounts which shall be deducted from the compensation or payroll of employees, all as required by such board under the provisions of chapter 75, Acts of the 50th Legislature of the State of Texas, as amended, and the director of finance is hereby authorized and directed to ascertain and certify officially on behalf of the city the prior service rendered to the city by each of the employees of the participating departments, and the average prior service compensation received by each, and to make and execute all prior service certifications and all other reports and certifications which may be required of the city under the provisions of chapter 75, Acts of the Regular Session, 50th Legislature, as amended, or in compliance with the rules and regulations of the board of trustees of the Texas Municipal Retirement System. 
(Code 1966, § 23-16)  
Sec. 82-42. - Increased municipal contributions to current service annuity reserve at retirement of employees. 
Effective January 1, 1973, for each month of current service thereafter rendered by each of its employees who are members of the Texas Municipal Retirement System, the city will contribute to the current service annuity reserve of each such member at the time of his retirement a sum that is 200 percent of such member's accumulated deposits for such month of employment; and such sum shall be contributed from the city's account in the municipality current service accumulation fund. 
(Code 1966, § 23-17)  
Sec. 82-43. - Antecedent service credit and special prior service credit. 
(a)  Each person who is an employee of the city on December 31, 1972, and who is at that date a member of the Texas Municipal Retirement System shall be allowed and, upon the terms and conditions prescribed by V.T.C.A., Government Code § 851.001 et seq., as amended, is hereby granted, effective on the date set out above, antecedent service credit (as that term is defined in such act) calculated on the following basis: Fifty percent of the sum of the current service deposits actually made by such person with the Texas Municipal Retirement System during each month of current service performed for this city prior to December 31, 1971 (together with compound interest allowed by the system on such deposits to such date); plus 50 percent of the sum of the current service deposits actually made by such person during each month of current service performed for this city prior to December 31, 1972 (together with compound interest allowed by the system on such deposits to the date last abovementioned). 
(b)  Each person who is an employee of the city on December 31, 1972, and who at such date is a member of the Texas Municipal Retirement System and who holds in such system an effective prior service certificate granted by reason of service performed for this city prior to its participation in such system, shall be allowed and is hereby granted (upon the terms and conditions prescribed by V.T.C.A., Government Code § 851.001 et seq.) a special prior service credit in an amount equivalent to the accumulation at interest, as provided in such act, of a series of monthly payments of five percent of the member's average prior service compensation for the number of months of prior service certified to in such member's prior service certificate. The special prior service credit provided for in this section shall be in addition to the prior service credit heretofore allowed such member. 
(c)  Any person who was employed by the city prior to December 31, 1972, whose membership in the Texas Municipal Retirement System by reason of such service has not terminated, and who on such date is absent from service in the employment of the city, shall be entitled to antecedent service credit and to special prior service credit in the amount he would have been allowed under subsections (a) and (b) of this section had he been in active service on such date, provided such person again becomes an employee of the city before termination of his membership in the Texas Municipal Retirement System and within five years from December 31, 1972, and provided such person thereupon continues as an employee of a participating department of the city for a period of five consecutive years. 
(Code 1966, § 23-18)  
Sec. 82-44. - Authorization of updated service credits. 
(a)  On the terms and conditions set out in Sections 853.401 through 853.403 of Subtitle G of Title 8, Government Code, as amended (hereinafter referred to as the "TMRS Act"), each member of the Texas Municipal Retirement System (hereinafter referred to as the "system") who has current service credit or prior service credit in said system in force and effect on the 1st day of January of the calendar year preceding such allowance, by reason of service in the employment of the city, and on such date has at least 36 months of credited service with said system, shall be and is hereby allowed "updated service credit" (as that term is defined in subsection (d) of Section 853.402 of said title) in an amount that is 100 percent of the "base updated service credit" of the member (calculated as provided in subsection (c) of Section 853.402 of said title). The updated service credit hereby allowed shall replace any updated service credit, prior service credit, special prior service credit, or antecedent service credit previously authorized for part of the same service. 
(b)  On the terms and conditions set out in Section 853.601 of said title, any member of the system who is eligible for updated service credits on the basis of service with this city, and who has unforfeited credit for prior service and/or current service with another participating municipality or municipalities by reason of previous service, and was a contributing member on the 1st day of January of the calendar year preceding such allowance, shall be credited with updated service credits pursuant to, calculated in accordance with, and subject to adjustment as set forth in said section 853.601. 
(c)  In accordance with the provisions of subsection (d) of Section 853.401 of said title, the deposits required to be made to the system by employees of the several participating departments on account of current service shall be calculated from and after the date aforesaid on the full amount of such person's earnings as an employee of the city. 
(d)  Effective date. Subject to approval by the Board of Trustees of the Texas Municipal Retirement System, the updated service credits granted hereby shall be and become effective on the 1st day of January, 2016. 
(Code 1966, § 23-20; Ord. No. 2002-83, § 1, 12-9-02; Ord. No. 2007-101, § 1, 12-10-07; Ord. No. 2009-61, § 1, 9-28-09; Ord. No. 2009-61, § 1, 9-28-09; Ord. No. 2012-95, 12-10-12; Ord. No. 2012-95, 12-10-12; Ord. No. 2015-85, 9-28-15)  
Sec. 82-45. - Vesting rights. 
(a)  An employee of the city who is a member of the system may terminate employment and remain eligible to retire and receive a service retirement annuity at any time after that member attains an applicable age and service requirement, if that member has at least ten years of credited service performed for one or more municipalities that have authorized eligibility under Section 854.202(c) of the Act or are subject to Section 854.102(e) of the Act. 
(b)  An employee of the city who is a member of the system may retire and receive a service retirement annuity if that member is at least 60 years old and has at least ten years of creditable service performed for one or more municipalities that either have authorized eligibility under this subsection or are subject to Section 854.102(e) of this subtitle. 
(c)  Any employee of this city who is a member of the system is eligible to retire and receive a service retirement annuity, if the member has at least 25 years of credited service in that system performed for one or more municipalities that have participation dates after August 31, 1987, or have adopted a like provision under Section 854.202(f) of the TMRS Act. 
(d)  If a member, to whom subsection (b) of Section 854.204 of the TMRS Act is applicable, shall die before becoming eligible for service retirement and leaves surviving a lawful spouse, whom the member has designated as beneficiary entitled to payment of the member's accumulated contributions in the event of the member's death before retirement, the surviving spouse may, by written notice filed with the system, elect to leave the accumulated deposits on deposit with the system subject to the terms and conditions of said Section 854.204(b). If the accumulated deposits have not been withdrawn before such time as the member, if living, would have become entitled to service retirement, the surviving spouse may elect to receive in lieu of the accumulated deposits, an annuity payable monthly thereafter during the lifetime of the surviving spouse in such amount as would have been payable had the member lived and retired at that date under a joint and survivor annuity (Option 1) payable during the lifetime of the member and continuing thereafter during the lifetime of the surviving spouse. 
(e)  At any time before payment of the first monthly benefit of an annuity, a surviving spouse to whom subsection (b) applies may, upon written application filed with the system, receive payment of the accumulated contributions standing to the account of the member in lieu of any benefits otherwise payable under this section. In the event such a surviving spouse shall die before payment of the first monthly benefit of an annuity allowed under this section, the accumulated contributions credited to the account of the member shall be paid to the estate of such spouse. 
(f)  An employee of this city who is a member of the system and who performed service for this city prior to September 1, 1987 (for which service that employee did not receive credit with the system because the employee was not at the time a member of the system due to his or her age at the date of his or her employment) is hereby granted service credit with the system for all of such service (performed after the date of his or her latest employment by the city) that is prior to September 1, 1987, for which the employee has not previously received credit with the system, pursuant to Section 852.105 of the Act. 
(g)  The rights, credits, and benefits hereinabove authorized shall be in addition to the plan provisions heretofore adopted and in force at the effective date of this ordinance pursuant to the TMRS Act. 
(Code 1966, § 23-21; Ord. No. 1998-110, § 1, 11-9-98)  
Sec. 82-46. - Disability annuity. 
(a)  Any employee of this city who is a member of the system is eligible to retire and receive a "standard occupational disability annuity" under Section 854.408 of the TMRS Act or an "optional occupational disability retirement annuity" under Section 854.410 of the TMRS Act upon making application therefor upon such form and in such manner as may be prescribed by the board of trustees of the system, provided that the system's medical board has certified to said board of trustees: (1) that the member is physically or mentally disabled for further performance of the duties of the member's employment; (2) that the disability is likely to be permanent; and (3) that the member should be retired. Any annuity granted under this subsection shall be subject to the provisions of Section 854.409 of the TMRS Act. 
(b)  The provisions relating to the occupational disability program as set forth in section (a) above are in lieu of the disability program heretofore provided for under Sections 854.301 to 854.308 of the TMRS Act. 
(Code 1966, § 23-22; Ord. No. 1998-110, § 2, 11-9-98)  
Sec. 82-47. - Agreement merging the City of McAllen Retirement System into Texas Municipal Retirement System. 
(a)  An agreement merging the "City of McAllen Retirement System" heretofore established under division 4 of this article II, into the Texas Municipal Retirement System, under substantially the terms and conditions contained in the "merger agreement" set out below, is hereby authorized and approved, and the mayor is authorized to execute the agreement on behalf of the city, and the city secretary is authorized to attest the execution of an agreement reading substantially as follows: 
MERGER AGREEMENT 
This Agreement is made by and between the City of McAllen, Texas (hereinafter "city") and the Texas Municipal Retirement System. 
WITNESSETH: 
1.  The "City of McAllen Retirement System" heretofore established by Ordinance No. 1995-2, as amended, (hereinafter referred to as the "Local Plan") shall be and become merged into the Texas Municipal Retirement System (hereinafter referred to as the "State System") pursuant to Subtitle G, Title 8, Government Code of Texas (hereinafter the "TMRS Act"), upon the terms and conditions set out in this agreement. Such merger shall be effective at 12:00 midnight on the 30th day of April, 1998, which date and time is hereinafter referred to as the "Effective Date of Merger." 
2.  The merger of the Local Plan into the State System is intended as a replacement and continuation of retirement and related benefits for participants of the Local Plan,a nd there shall be no gap or lapse in time or effect between the coverage under the Local Plan and coverage under the State System. 
3.  The City shall continue as a participating municipality of the State System after the effective date of merger, and all of its departments, with the exception of the Fire Department as to employees eligible to participate in the McAllen Firemen's Relief and Retirement Fund, shall be participating departments in the State System. 
4.  All persons who are participants in the Local Plan at the effective date of merger shall become members of the State System at that time and date, and shall be considered as "employee" of the City. Except as specifically modified by the express terms of this agreement, the rights and obligations of Local Plan participants who become members of the State System pursuant to this agreement shall be governed by the provisions of the TMRS Act. 
5.  Prior to the Effective Date of Merger, the City shall cause the appropriate officials administering the Local Plan to convert the assets of the Local Plan into cash, and the proceeds shall be delivered to the Director of the State System to be deposited to the individual accounts of Local Plan participants becoming members of the State System, and to the account of the City in the System, as hereinbelow provided. 
6.  (a) 
The City shall prepare and deliver to the System a certified list of the names and Social Security numbers of all persons who at the Effective Date of Merger are participants in the Local Plan, along with the amount of accumulated deposits standing to the credit of their respective individual accounts in the Local Plan at that date, and the number of months during which the person was employed by the City and participated in the Local Plan prior to the Effective Date of Merger. Upon receipt of such certified list, and delivery to it of the Local Plan assets, the State System shall establish a separate individual account in the Employee Saving Fund, and shall deposit therein the sum equal to his/her accumulated deposits in the Local Plan. Such accounts shall thereafter constitute the member's individual account in the State System under Section 855.306 of the TMRS Act. 
(b)  As of December 31, 1998, interest shall be allowed by the State System on the beginning (date of transfer) balance of each member account established pursuant to paragraph (a), above, for the period intervening between date of transfer and the end of the year at the rate allowed on the individual accounts of non-merger members of the State System for the year 1998; for each year thereafter, interest shall be allowed and credited on such individual accounts in the manner and at the same rates as may be allowed on the individual accounts of non-merger members. 
(c)  Local Plan participants who become members of the State System by virtue of this agreement, shall not be allowed "prior service credit" by reason of service to the City prior to the Effective Date of merger, but each month of service performed by such person for the City while he/she was a participant in the Local Plan shall be considered and treated as "creditable current service" with like effect as if the service had been performed had the person been a member of the State system at the time of its performance; and the amount transferred to the individual's account established pursuant to paragraph (b), above, shall be included in calculating the current service annuity of a member pursuant to section 854.002 of the TMRS Act, along with other deposits made to that account by reason of service after the Effective Date of Merger. 
(d)  Service rendered to the City subsequent to the Effective Date of Merger by those persons becoming members of the State System under this agreement shall constitute current service as defined by the TMRS Act, and those members shall make the same contributions as are required of other persons becoming members by reason of employment by the City in a participating department after the Effective Date of Merger. 
7.  Assets of the Local Plan remaining after the transfer required to establish individual accounts for participants under paragraph 6.(a) above, shall be transferred by the City to the System, and shall be deposited in the City's account in the Municipality Accumulation Fund, and shall be used for all obligations of the City chargeable to such account. 
8.  (a) 
Words and terms defined in the TMRS Act when used in this agreement shall have the statutory meaning, unless the context clearly indicates another meaning. 
(b)  The rights and obligations of persons who become members of the State System by virtue of this agreement and/or the participation of the City, including: eligibility for service retirement, and the standard service retirement benefit of members so retiring; optional benefits, and the rights of vesting and of deferred retirement; eligibility for disability retirement and the standard benefits payable therefor; death benefits payable by reason of death of members before or after retirement; termination of membership, and rights and consequences of withdrawal of member deposits, shall be governed by the provisions of the TMRS Act, except as expressly modified by this Agreement. It is further understood and agreed that except as to the vested right of members of the State System in the accumulated deposits in their individual accounts, the State of Texas retains the right and power to amend the laws pertaining to the State System and to the benefits payable under such laws, and nothing in this agreement is intended in derogation thereof. 
(Ord. No. 1998-39, § III, 3-26-98)  
Sec. 82-48. - Authorization of restricted prior service credit. 
(a)  On the terms and conditions set out in Sections 853.305 of Subtitle G of Title 8, Texas Government Code, as amended (hereinafter referred to as the "TMRS Act"), each member of the Texas Municipal Retirement System (hereinafter referred to as the "system") who is now or who hereafter becomes an employee of this City shall receive restricted prior service credit for service previously performed as an employee of any of the entities described in said Section 853.305 provided that (1) the person does not otherwise have credited service in the system for that service, and (2) the service meets the requirements of said Section 853.305. 
(b)  The service credit hereby granted may be used only to satisfy length-of-service requirements for retirement eligibility, has no monetary value in computing the annuity payments allowable to the member, and may not be used in other computations, including computation of updated service credit. 
(c)  A member seeking to establish restricted prior service credit under this section must take the action under said Section 853.305 while still an employee of this City. 
(Ord. No. 1999-61, § 1, 6-28-99) 
Editor's note— Ord. No. 1999-61, § 1, adopted June 28, 1999, did not specifically amend the Code; hence, inclusion herein as § 82-48 was at the discretion of the editor.  
Sec. 82-49. - Credited service previously canceled. 
Pursuant to § 853.003 of Subtitle G of Title 8, V.T.C.A., Government Code, as amended, the City of McAllen hereby elects to allow any member of the Texas Municipal Retirement System who is an employee of this city on the 27th day of December, 2007, who has terminated a previous membership in said system by withdrawal of deposits while absent from service, but who has at least 24 months of credit service as an employee of this city since resuming membership to deposit with the system in a lump sum the amount withdrawn, plus a withdrawal charge of five percent of such amount for each year from date of such withdrawal to date of redeposit, and thereupon such member shall be allowed credit for all service to which the member had been entitled at date of termination of earlier membership, with like effect as if all such service had been rendered as an employee of this city, whether so rendered or not. The city agrees to underwrite and hereby assumes the obligations arising out of the granting of such credits, and agrees that all such obligations and reserves required to provide such credits shall be charged to this city's account in the municipality accumulation fund. The five percent per annum withdrawal charge paid by the member shall be deposited to the credit of the city's account in such municipality accumulation fund; and the deposits of the amount previously withdrawn by the member shall be credited to his or her individual account in the employees' savings fund of the system. 
(Ord. No. 2007-101, § 2, 12-10-07)  
Sec. 82-50. - "Twenty-year any age" retirement eligibility. 
(a)  Pursuant to the provisions of § 854.202(g) of Subtitle G of Title 8, Texas Government Code, as amended, as amended, which subtitle shall herein be referred to as the "TMRS Act," the City of McAllen, Texas, adopts the following provisions affecting participation of its employees in the Texas Municipal Retirement System (herein referred to as the "system"): 
(b)  Any employee of the city who is a member of the system is eligible to retire and receive a service retirement annuity if the member has at least 20 years of credited service in the system performed for one or more municipalities that have adopted a like provision under Section 854.202(g) of the TMRS Act. 
(c)  Prior to adopting this section, the governing body of the city has: 
(1)  Prepared an actuarial analysis of member retirement annuities at 20 years of service; and 
(2)  Held a public hearing pursuant to the notice provisions of the Texas Open Meetings Act, V.T.C.A., Texas Government Code ch. 551. 
(d)  The rights hereinabove authorized shall be in addition to the plan provisions heretofore adopted and in force at the effective date of this section pursuant to the TMRS Act. 
(e)  Effective date. Subject to approval by the board of trustees of the Texas Municipal Retirement System, the 20-year any age service retirement granted hereby shall be and become effective on the 1st day of October 2009. 
(Ord. No. 2009-61, § 1, 9-28-09)  
Secs. 82-51—82-55. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 3. - FIREFIGHTERS' RELIEF AND RETIREMENT FUND 
 
Sec. 82-56. - Definitions. 
The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this division, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
Member means a certified firefighter or dispatcher employee of the fire department as such term is defined under the state local firefighters' retirement act and shall include all participants in the city firefighters' retirement fund. 
(Code 1966, § 23-53; Ord. No. 1997-28, § II, 4-15-97) 
Cross reference— Definitions and rules of construction generally, § 1-2.  
Sec. 82-57. - State law adopted. 
The city hereby adopts and makes applicable to the fire department and the firefighters of the city the provisions of the state local firefighters' retirement act codified as V.T.C.A., Government Code § 851.001 et seq. and such act and retirement fund is extended to all members of the fire department as authorized under the provisions of the act. The city automatically, without further action, adopts any general amendments to the act upon their enactment except those which specifically require additional action of the board of commissioners relating thereto. 
(Code 1966, § 23-54)  
Sec. 82-58. - Deductions from salaries of paid members. 
Effective the first full pay period after April 13, 1998, the city shall deduct an amount equal to ten percent from the monthly salary or compensation of each participating fully paid member firefighter of the firefighters' relief and retirement fund. 
(Code 1966, § 23-55; Ord. No. 1998-42, § I, 4-13-98) 
State Law reference— Similar provisions, Vernon's Ann. Civ. St. art. 6243e, § 10A-2.  
Sec. 82-59. - Contribution by city. 
Effective on the first full pay period after October 1st, 2001, the city shall contribute an amount equal to 11 percent of the monthly salary or compensation of each participating fully paid member firefighter to the firefighters' relief and retirement fund. 
(Code 1966, § 23-57; Ord. No. 1998-42, § I, 4-13-98; Ord. No. 2001-65, § 1, 9-24-01)  
Sec. 82-60. - Deductions, payments and contributions to become part of fund. 
Money deducted from salaries or compensation as provided for in this division and the payments and contributions provided for by this division shall become and form a part of the firefighters' relief and retirement fund of the city. 
(Code 1966, § 23-59) 
State Law reference— Similar provisions, Vernon's Ann. Civ. St. art. 6243e, § 10A(d).  
Sec. 82-61. - Appropriations for city's contributions. 
The sum necessary to make the annual contributions to the fund required by the city under this division is hereby appropriated and set aside out of the unappropriated surplus in the general fund of the city, and there is also appropriated and set aside from the next succeeding tax levy or levies a sum sufficient to make such annual payment, which sum shall be levied, assessed and collected from the ad valorem tax levy annually. 
(Code 1966, § 23-60)  
Sec. 82-62. - Income tax deferral. 
The board of commissioners hereby authorizes and elects that the provisions of V.T.C.A., Government Code § 851.001 et seq., as amended, are hereby adopted by the city for the purposes of permitting the contributions of the city firefighters to the city firefighters' pension fund to be deferred for the purposes of payment of federal income taxes under the provisions of section 401(a) of the Federal Internal Revenue Code. The city manager is hereby directed to execute any and all documents representing the board of commissioners' action under this section and is further authorized to take any and all actions to carry out the necessary requirements under the state pension law and the Internal Revenue Code to qualify the city firefighter's pension and retirement fund under the act for such purposes. 
(Code 1966, § 23-61)  
Secs. 82-63—82-65. - Reserved.

ARTICLE III. - FEDERAL OLD AGE AND SURVIVOR'S BENEFITS  
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 
 
Sec. 82-86. - Execution of agreements. 
(a)  The board of commissioners, acting for and on behalf of the city, shall enter into all necessary agreements with the state department of public welfare for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of applicable state and federal laws in securing federal old age and survivor's insurance benefits for city employees. 
(b)  The mayor is hereby appointed as agent of the board of commissioners and of the city to execute all necessary agreements and instruments for and in behalf of the board of commissioners and the city. 
(c)  The mayor is authorized to act as the agent of the board of commissioners to execute any and all necessary contracts, agreements and instruments of every kind and character to bring about the desired result of including employees of the city performing services in part-time positions with respect only to positions not subject to the firefighters' relief and retirement fund or the Texas Municipal Retirement System. 
(Code 1966, § 23-27)  
Sec. 82-87. - Duties of director of finance. 
The director of finance is hereby directed to be the person responsible for making assessments, collections, payments and reports, as required by the state department of public welfare in connection with the federal old age and survivor's insurance program. 
(Code 1966, § 23-28)  
Sec. 82-88. - Fund established. 
A sufficient sum of money shall be allocated and set aside from available funds for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of the state and federal laws relating to the federal old age and survivor's insurance program, such money so allocated and set aside to be known as the City of McAllen Social Security Fund, which fund shall be set aside and maintained in the regular city depository. 
(Code 1966, § 23-29) 
Charter reference— City depository, art. 7, § 7.  
Secs. 82-89—82-100. - Reserved.

ARTICLE IV. - CIVIL SERVICE FOR POLICE AND FIRE DEPARTMENTS 
 
Sec. 82-126. - Civil service commission. 
By virtue of the election held on November 7, 1989, in and for the city relating to the creation of the firefighters and police officers civil service, there is hereby established in the city a firefighters' and police officers' civil service commission in compliance with V.T.C.A., Local Government Code ch. 143. Such civil service commission shall administer the civil service program for the fire and police departments in accordance with the provisions of such chapter 143, as such provisions are applicable to the city. The civil service commission shall be designated office space within the confines of city hall for the purpose of carrying out civil service business. The city personnel policies and procedures, insofar as they conflict with the provisions of such chapter 143, the rules and regulations as adopted by the civil service commission or the rules and regulations as promulgated by the fire and police departments, to the extent that such rules and regulations are in conflict, shall not be applicable to the fire and police department civil service employees. 
(Code 1966, § 23-65)  
Sec. 82-127. - Action by board of commissioners. 
The board of commissioners may from time to time by ordinance, provided however, without the necessity of publication in the Code of Ordinances, take necessary action as required under V.T.C.A., Local Government Code ch. 143 for appointment of department heads, approval of classifications of civil service employees, approval of appointments of positions immediately below department heads and approval of classifications according to pay in addition to base pay and other matters as required by V.T.C.A., Local Government Code ch. 143. 
(Code 1966, § 23-66)  
Sec. 82-128. - Appointments to positions immediately below department heads. 
The department heads of the fire and police departments in the city may appoint persons to occupy any authorized position in the classification immediately below that of the chiefs (department heads) as provided in this section. In the police department, the total number of persons appointed to the classification immediately below that of the chief (department head) may not exceed three people, in accordance with the provisions of V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 143.014. In the fire department, the total number of persons appointed to the classification immediately below that of chief (department head) may not exceed one person, in accordance with the provisions of V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 143.014. The chiefs (department heads) are hereby directed to make such appointments on October 31, 1990, being the effective date of the civil service provisions for the city. The authority of any persons holding such positions prior to such date shall remain in full force and effect until that date. The chiefs making the respective appointments under this section are hereby directed to comply with the provisions of V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 143.014 to ensure that the persons so appointed meet the qualifications as prescribed therein. The effective date of this section shall be October 31, 1990. 
(Code 1966, § 23-67)  
Secs. 82-129—82-150. - Reserved.
